      • validateInvoiceDate

        public static java.lang.String validateInvoiceDate(AccountInvoice accountInvoice)
        NOTE: Cannot validate invoice date if PaymentDueDate or EventDate is null
        Parameters:
        accountInvoice - Account invoice to validate.
        Returns:
        A non-null error message if validation fails.

      • validateInvoiceDate

                                   boolean dueDateWillBeAdjusted)
        Validates that the invoice date is valid
        Parameters:
        accountInvoice - the invoice
        nextInvoiceDate - the next invoice date
        dueDateWillBeAdjusted - whether the due date will be adjusted
        Returns:
        null if there is no error message, otherwise the error message

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        null if there is no error message, otherwise the error message

      • deleteInvoices

        public static void deleteInvoices(AccountInvoice[] invoices)
        Deletes the given invoices and commits the change immediately. Should not throw an exception unless there is a low level database error, but if there is such an error none of the invoices will be deleted (the deletions are committed as a single transaction).
        Parameters:
        invoices - the invoices to be deleted

      • moveInvoiceItems

        public static void moveInvoiceItems(Invoice toInvoice,
                    InvoiceItem... invoiceItemsToMove)
        Move the invoice items to another invoice.
        Parameters:
        toInvoice - The Invoice to move the items to
        invoiceItemsToMove - The invoice items to be moved

      • getUserVisibleInvoiceItemTypes

        public static InvoiceItemType[] getUserVisibleInvoiceItemTypes()
        Returns:
        the user visible invoice item types

      • validateItemsForMove

        public static void validateItemsForMove(InvoiceItem... invoiceItemsToMove)
        Performs validation for moving InvoiceItems to another Invoice. Two criteria must be met to perform a move: 1) All InvoiceItems must have the same Payer. 2) If the payer is a producer, none of the InvoiceItems may have any Billed transactions

        Failing either one of these criteria will cause an exception to be thrown.

        Parameters:
        invoiceItemsToMove - Invoice items to move to another invoice.
